headlines.description: Rui Hachimura scored 19 points, Josh Perkins added 16, and No. 20 Gonzaga beat Pacific 81-48 on Thursday night, winning its 22nd consecutive West Coast Conference opener.
headlines.shortLinkText: Hachimura, Perkins lead No. 20 Gonzaga over Pacific 81-48

headlines.description: Khadeen Carrington hit a go-ahead layup with 2:05 to play and No. 23 Seton Hall rallied from a 13-point second-half deficit to defeat No. 25 Creighton 90-84 in the Big East Conference opener for both schools on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: No.  23 Seton Hall rallies to beat No. 25 Creighton

headlines.description: Ahmed Hill led a balanced attack with 14 points as Virginia Tech beat an overmatched North Carolina A&T squad 76-59 on Thursday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Virginia Tech overpowers North Carolina A&T for a 76-59 win

headlines.description: Thatch Unruh scored 20 points, Jordan Howard added 18 and Central Arkansas opened Southland Conference play with an 81-69 win over Texas A&M Corpus Christi on Thursday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Unruth, Howard lead C Arkansas past A&M-CC 81-69

headlines.description: Ryan Allen scored a career-high 24 points, Ryan Daly had 19, including four free throws in the final five seconds of overtime, and Delaware outlasted Cornell 97-96 on Thursday despite two players scoring more than 30 points for the Big Red.
headlines.shortLinkText: Allen, Daly lift Delaware past Cornell 97-96 in OT

headlines.description: Junior Etou scored 20 points, surpassing 1,000 for his career, and added a career-high 14 rebounds and Tulsa won its American Conference opener over East Carolina 79-53 on Thursday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Etou gets 1,000, Tulsa tops E Carolina 79-53 to open league

headlines.description: Rodrick Caldwell scored 15 points and Bowling Green cruised in its final nonconference game, defeating NAIA Lourdes 97-56 on Thursday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Caldwell, Bowling Green pound Lourdes 97-56

headlines.description: John Carroll scored 17 points and grabbed nine rebounds and Hassan Attia scored 11 points to go with another nine rebounds as Hartford pulled off its first win at Rutgers, nipping the Scarlet Knights 60-58 on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Hartford holds off late rally, upsets Rutgers, 60-58

headlines.description: Melvin Frazier scored 25 points with seven assists, Cameron Reynolds added 17 points with 10 rebounds, and Tulane pulled ahead early and held on to beat Temple 85-75 in an American Conference opener on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Frazier scores 25, Tulane beats Temple 85-75

headlines.description: Corey Davis Jr., scored 15 points and Armoni Brooks scored 14 and Houston defeated South Florida 79-60 Thursday for the Cougars' third straight win.
headlines.shortLinkText: Houston tops S. Florida 79-60 behind Davis and Brooks

headlines.description: Kyron Cartwright and Alpha Diallo both posted double-doubles and Providence caught fire in the second half to cruise to a 94-72 victory over St. John's on Thursday night in the Big East Conference opener for both teams.
headlines.shortLinkText: Providence tops St. John's in Big East opener

headlines.description: Ria'n Holland scored 20 points and Mercer rolled to an 89-56 victory over Kennesaw State on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Holland scores 20, leads Mercer over Kennesaw State 89-56

headlines.description: David Burrell had his first career double-double with 18 points and 10 rebounds to lead East Tennessee State to an 84-65 victory over Division II Tusculum on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Burrell leads ETSU to 84-65 win over D-II Tusculum

headlines.description: Jordan Barnes buried 4 of 5 from 3-point range and scored 18 with five rebounds, three assists and two steals to propel Indiana State to a 73-64 victory over Valparaiso on Thursday night in a Missouri Valley Conference opener for both teams.
headlines.shortLinkText: Indiana State holds off Valparaiso in MVC opener

headlines.description: Travis Charles scored 19 points with nine rebounds and five assists, and his jumper sparked a game-changing run that let Albany pull away from Kent State for a 78-68 win on Thursday night to conclude non-conference play.
headlines.shortLinkText: Albany pulls away from Kent State 78-68 behind Charles

headlines.description: CJ Massinburg sparked a late run as Buffalo fought to force overtime and then Wes Clark scored 13 of his 27 points in the OT as Buffalo defeated NJIT 86-81 Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Massinburg, Clark help Buffalo top NJIT 86-81 in overtime

headlines.description: Jailen Gill hit a jumper to give UT Martin the lead in overtime and the Skyhawks held on to beat in-state rival Tennessee State, 63-60 in the Ohio Valley Conference opener Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: UT Martin holds off Tennessee State, 63-60 in OVC opener

headlines.description: Tyler Nelson scored 19 points to help Fairfield beat Saint Peter's 70-61 on Thursday night in a Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference opener.
headlines.shortLinkText: Fairfield beats Saint Peter's 70-61 in MAAC opener

headlines.description: JD Notae scored a career-high 30 points and Jalyn Hinton grabbed a career-high 14 rebounds and Jacksonville beat NAIA Middle Georgia State 81-60 on Thursday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Jacksonville pulls away to beat Middle Georgia St. 81-60

headlines.description: Justin Mitchell totaled 14 points and six rebounds, Mark Hughes added 13 points and five assists and Grant Benzinger finished with a double-double to carry Wright State to a 65-61 victory over Illinois-Chicago on Thursday night in a Horizon League...
headlines.shortLinkText: Wright St opens Horizon League play with win over UIC

headlines.description: Rondale Watson scored 20 points, Ajdin Penava added 18 with 15 rebounds, four assists and four blocks, and Marshall beat Southern Miss 85-66 in Thursday night's Conference USA opener for both teams.
headlines.shortLinkText: Marshall beats Southern Miss 85-66 in Conference USA opener

headlines.description: Quatarrius Wilson and Kalob Ledoux combined for 39 points as McNeese opened Southland Conference play with an 85-62 thumping of Incarnate Word on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: McNeese thumps Incarnate Word 85-62 in Southland opener

headlines.description: Cameron Young scored 20 points, Jacob Rigoni added another 18 and Quinnipiac opened the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference season by holding off Monmouth for a 78-76 win on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Quinnipiac holds off Monmouth, 78-76 to take MAAC opener

headlines.description: Drew McDonald scored 27 points and grabbed 10 rebounds and Northern Kentucky shot 57 percent from the floor to defeat Horizon League newcomer IUPUI 77-59 in the conference opener on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: McDonald scores 27, N Kentucky beats IUPUI 77-59 in Horizon

headlines.description: Travin Thibodeaux made two free throws and Makur Puou slammed home a dunk in the final seconds as New Orleans came back to beat Abilene Christian 77-74 in the Southland Conference opener on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: New Orleans rallies to beat Abilene Christian 77-74

headlines.description: Marlain Veal scored 27 points and grabbed a career-high 10 rebounds and Southeastern Louisiana beat Stephen F. Austin 73-62 on Thursday night in a Southland Conference opener for both teams.
headlines.shortLinkText: Veal leads SE Louisiana past Stephen F. Austin, 73-62

headlines.description: James Harrison had 22 points and Zjori Bosha added 19 as Lamar rolled to a dominating 86-68 win over Houston Baptist to open Southland Conference play and halt a four-game losing streak on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Lamar opens league play with 86-68 win over Houston Baptist

headlines.description: Kimani Jackson and Tevon Saddler scored 14 points apiece and Nicholls never trailed in beating Northwestern State 87-46 in their Southland Conference opener Thursday night for the Colonels' largest margin of victory in conference play.
headlines.shortLinkText: Nicholls routs Northwestern State 87-46 in Southland opener

headlines.description: Marcus Bartley hit back-to-back a 3-pointers as Southern Illinois fought into the lead early in the second quarter, and Armon Fletcher hit a big 3 inside the final minute as the Salukis had just enough to hold off Northern Iowa 56-53 in the opener of...
headlines.shortLinkText: Southern Illinois holds off Northern Iowa 56-53 in MVC

headlines.description: Graham Woodward and Ore Arogundade hit back-to-back 3-pointers to give Drake the lead and Nick McGlynn's two free throws made it stand up for a 66-64 win over Bradley in the Missouri Valley Conference opener on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Late 3s give Drake a 66-64 win over Bradley in MVC opener

headlines.description: Isaiah Ross scored 20 points to lead five players into double-figure scoring and UMKC cruised to an 89-58 win over NAIA hometown rival Avila on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: UMKC starts fast, closes strong; beats NAIA Avila 89-58

headlines.description: Averyl Ugba and Terry Taylor combined for 40 points and 21 rebounds as Austin Peay opened up Ohio Valley Conference play with a 78-58 win over SIU-Edwardsville Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Ugba, Taylor help Austin Peay take OVC opener 78-58

headlines.description: Ja Morant distributed 14 assists, scored 11 points and grabbed 10 rebounds for his first triple-double and Murray State pulled away from Eastern Illinois for an 80-52 win Thursday night to start Ohio Valley Conference play.
headlines.shortLinkText: Morant's triple-double leads Murray St. past E. Illinois

headlines.description: Sandy Cohen III tossed in 24 points to lead five players in double figures and Green Bay rolled to a 95-83 victory over Detroit Mercy in a Horizon League opener on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Green Bay beats Detroit Mercy 95-83 in Horizon League opener

headlines.description: Kendrick Nunn scored 36 points on 12-of-21 shooting with five 3-pointers and four assists and Oakland beat Milwaukee 76-68 in their Horizon League opener on Thursday night for the Golden Grizzlies third straight win.
headlines.shortLinkText: Oakland downs Milwaukee 76-68 behind Nunn's 36 points

headlines.description: Dwight Coleby scored 16 points, grabbed 15 rebounds and had a huge block in the last five seconds as Western Kentucky held on to defeat Louisiana Tech 69-68 on Thursday night in a Conference USA opener.
headlines.shortLinkText: Coleby's late block helps W Kentucky edge Louisiana Tech

headlines.description: Jhivvan Jackson had his second straight 20-point scoring game to spark Texas-San Antonio to a 79-66 win over Rice in the Conference USA opener on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Jackson's 20 sparks UTSA past Rice, 79-66 in C-USA opener

headlines.description: Marlon Hunter scored 20 points, Norbertas Giga had 14 points and 13 rebounds, and Jacksonville State beat Eastern Kentucky 76-58 on Thursday night in an Ohio Valley Conference opener.
headlines.shortLinkText: Jacksonville State rolls in OVC opener, beats EKU 76-58

headlines.description: Amanze Egekeze had a perfect night shooting to total 21 points as Belmont scored 47 points in each half to roll over Southeast Missouri State 94-72 in the Ohio Valley Conference opener on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Egekeze has perfect night, Belmont wins OVC opener

headlines.description: Curtis Phillips Jr., scored 17 points with 10 rebounds and made the game-winning shot at the buzzer to lift Tennessee Tech to a 69-67 Ohio Valley Conference opening win against Morehead State Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Phillips sends Tennessee Tech past Morehead St., 69-67

headlines.description: Tyler Hall poured in 36 points on 12-of-19 shooting from the floor, including 8 of 14 from 3-point range, and Harald Frey added a career-best 30 points with six assists and four steals to help Montana State hold off Southern Utah 104-99 on Thursday...
headlines.shortLinkText: Hall, Frey lift Montana State over Southern Utah 104-99

headlines.description: Jamar Akoh scored 23 points and grabbed 10 rebounds, Ahmaad Rorie added 22 points with four 3-pointers, and Montana beat Northern Arizona 87-69 in Thursday night's Big Sky Conference opener.
headlines.shortLinkText: Akoh, Rorie combine for 45, Montana downs N. Arizona 87-69

headlines.description: Yoeli Childs scored a career-high 26 points and grabbed 13 rebounds, Elijah Bryant added 22 points with a career-high 15 boards, and BYU beat Portland 68-45 in a West Coast Conference opener on Thursday night for its ninth straight win.
headlines.shortLinkText: BYU beats Portland 68-45 on career night for Childs, Bryant

headlines.description: Isaiah Pineiro scored 23 points, Isaiah Wright added 17 with six assists and San Diego rolled past San Francisco 73-63 Thursday night in a West Coast Conference opener.
headlines.shortLinkText: Pineiro, Wright spark San Diego to 73-63 WCC opener

headlines.description: Tremont Waters had 18 points and eight assists and Skylar Mays added 14 points as LSU used a torrid second-half shooting display to defeat Memphis 71-61 on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Waters, Mays lead LSU over Memphis 71-61

headlines.description: Daniel Amigo scored 24 points to lead Denver to a 106-60 rout of Division II Colorado Mesa University on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Denver routs Division II Colorado Mesa University 106-60

headlines.description: Brandon Randolph and Conner Toolson scored 20 points apiece as Utah Valley sprinted to an early lead and then held off UC Riverside for a 90-82 win on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Randolph, Toolson help Utah Valley hold off UC Riverside

headlines.description: Roosevelt Smart scored 29 -- including North Texas' last 15 points -- to send the Mean Green past UTEP 63-62 Thursday night in a Conference USA opener for both teams.
headlines.shortLinkText: Smart sends N. Texas past UTEP 63-62

headlines.description: KJ Feagin and Henry Caruso scored 10 points in the final minutes as Santa Clara held off Pepperdine for a 72-65 win to open West Coast Conference play on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Santa Clara holds off Pepperdine for 72-65 WCC win

headlines.description: Zach Lofton hit 6 of 8 from the free throw line in the final two minutes to preserve New Mexico State's 65-60 win over UC Irvine on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Lofton carries New Mexico State past UC Irvine, 65-60

headlines.description: Josh Hearlihy filled up the stat sheet with 21 points, four rebounds, three assists, two steals and a blocked shot to propel Seattle to a 93-63 victory over Grambling on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Seattle rolls past road-weary Grambling 93-63

headlines.description: Jock Landale tallied 21 points and nine rebounds and Jordan Ford hit four 3-pointers and scored 17 to propel Saint Mary's to an 87-59 victory over Loyola Marymount in a West Coast Conference opener on Thursday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Landale leads Saint Mary's to victory over LMU in WCC opener

nowFeed.headline: USC junior forward Bennie Boatwright will miss the rest of the season after suffering a left patella injury during Thursday's win, per the school. Was averaging 13.6 points and 6.4 rebounds.
nowFeed.story: USC junior forward Bennie Boatwright will miss the rest of the season after suffering a left patella injury during Thursday's win, per the school. Was averaging 13.6 points and 6.4 rebounds.

nowFeed.story: Back at @KUHoops Brings back a great memory thanks to a great group of players. @LBSUhoops vimeo.com/256137612

nowFeed.headline: Under Sean Miller Deandre Ayton is maximizing his enormous potential. Ayton has always possessed the physical tools and a solid basketball IQ. He has worked hard at Zona along with making the adjustments to college basketball. For a freshman big man it's really hard to dominate right away. Since he arrived in the states he was a top ranked player in his class. Would have been top 5 in last years NBA draft. Now he will be a top 3 pick and will be much more prepared.
nowFeed.story: Under Sean Miller Deandre Ayton is maximizing his enormous potential. Ayton has always possessed the physical tools and a solid basketball IQ. He has worked hard at Zona along with making the adjustments to college basketball. For a freshman big man it's really hard to dominate right away. Since he arrived in the states he was a top ranked player in his class. Would have been top 5 in last years NBA draft. Now he will be a top 3 pick and will be much more prepared.

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati shot just 6-for-19 (31.6%) in the second half vs. Houston, including a FG drought of nearly 12 minutes down the stretch. The Bearcats got out rebounded 36-27. Both of those bit them tonight.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati shot just 6-for-19 (31.6%) in the second half vs. Houston, including a FG drought of nearly 12 minutes down the stretch. The Bearcats got out rebounded 36-27. Both of those bit them tonight.

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati's loss at Houston will likely drop them from the No. 2-seed line in Joe Lunardi's Bracketology, with Texas Tech likely being the beneficiary to move up. The Cougars, who were a 10-seed coming into the night, scored another big resume win after picking one up over Wichita State in January.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati's loss at Houston will likely drop them from the No. 2-seed line in Joe Lunardi's Bracketology, with Texas Tech likely being the beneficiary to move up. The Cougars, who were a 10-seed coming into the night, scored another big resume win after picking one up over Wichita State in January.

nowFeed.headline: Houston upsets No. 5 Cincinnati 67-62, ending the Bearcats nation-leading 16-game winning streak. It's the first time the Cougars have beaten two top-10 opponents in a season since 1984.
nowFeed.story: Houston upsets No. 5 Cincinnati 67-62, ending the Bearcats nation-leading 16-game winning streak. It's the first time the Cougars have beaten two top-10 opponents in a season since 1984.

nowFeed.headline: Ironically, Cincinnati's loss to Houston also finally gives Cincinnati its first win over a likely NCAA Tournament team.
nowFeed.story: Ironically, Cincinnati's loss to Houston also finally gives Cincinnati its first win over a likely NCAA Tournament team.

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati getting it done at the foul line tonight, hitting 17-of-21 free throw attempts. The Bearcats are hanging on to a 50-49 lead over Houston with 4:10 left.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati getting it done at the foul line tonight, hitting 17-of-21 free throw attempts. The Bearcats are hanging on to a 50-49 lead over Houston with 4:10 left.
